channel.title: Copy of Digg top 24 hours
channel.description: RSS feed with direct links to popular technology articles. based on superdigg pipe

item.title: [+1444] I'm a Big Fan of Gmail's New Logo [GIF]
item.description: I just deleted my Hotmail account and switched to Gmail because of this.

item.title: [+1382] The Tea Party's Phony Populism
item.description: A new New York Times poll shows Tea Partiers are grumpy, older, well-off Americans who think white people are oppressed; in other words, Republicans.

item.title: [+1368] The 7 Most Soul-Crushing Series Finales in TV History
item.description: There are two ways to end a televisions series: Quietly and respectfully or by loading as much WTF fuel into the last show as possible. Guess which option these guys chose?

item.title: [+1242] Obama mandates new same-sex partner benefit rights
item.description: President Obama mandated Thursday that nearly all hospitals extend visitation rights to the partners of gay men and lesbians and respect patients' choices about who may make critical health-care decisions for them, the most significant step so far in his efforts to expand the rights of...

item.title: [+1205] Apple Fans Are Clueless About Security, Hacker Says
item.description: Not only are Apple fans misguided about the Mac's security, but Apple doesn't take security as seriously as Microsoft, according to one expert.

item.title: [+1120] Pope Benedict Accused of Masterminding Sex Abuse Cover-Up
item.description: Pope Benedict has been accused of masterminding the child sex-abuse cover up which has rocked the Catholic Church.

item.title: [+1103] Hippobombamus (pic)
[+1015] The Dumbest Tax Day Signs
item.description: The crazies were out in full force yesterday! Unlike the fake teabagger signs in Boston, these are real and really dumb.

item.title: [+987] How Digg is Reinventing Itself
item.description: Digg’s VP of business development about the latest developments at Digg. “The general feeling is one of excitement; we are on the precipice of launching the new Digg, and getting back to our roots of innovation, entrepreneurial vision, and moving at light speed in the online media space.”

item.title: [+920] Street Sea Monster [pic]
[+904] Surprise! GOP To Block Senate Debate on Wall Street Reform
item.description: Mitch McConnell has rounded up the necessary votes to block Democrats from bringing Wall Street reform to the Senate floor, a spokesman for the Senate Minority Leader said on Friday afternoon.

item.title: [+844] Google Turns to HTML5 for Gmail’s New Drag& Drop Attachments
item.description: Google continues to use HTML5 to push its web apps into the future. The latest bit of HTML5 to feel Google’s love is drag-and-drop support, which is now a standard part of Gmail. If you’re using Google Chrome 4 or Firefox 3.6, you can now simply drag a file from your desktop onto a message window and Gmail will automatically attach the file.

item.title: [+662] Girl banned from literally every bar and pub in England
item.description: England is fairly well known for its liberal usage of alcohol. So when a 20-year-old girl is banned from literally every pub and bar in the country, well, she’s probably a bit of a problem.

item.title: [+652] This Is How A Pineapple Grows. That is All. (PIC)
[+614] Internet Porn: Risks vs. Rewards [CHART]
item.description: Historians have referred to Internet Porn not only as one of the most important advancements of the technological era, but also 'sooooo awesome'.

item.title: [+611] Sexual Encounters Breakdown
item.description: An honest look at sexual time management.

item.title: [+591] Portal 2 coming to E3; Valve hosting event June 14
item.description: The hints were all there, but a recent invitation from Valve confirms it.

item.title: [+518] Apple to Launch New iTunes "Concert Ticket +" System
item.description: Apple has been exploring the concept of an iPhone- and iTunes-based system for event tickets, a patent application reveals.

item.title: [+492] Massive 2TB Hard Drive Round-up: A Pornocopia of Storage
item.description: Got a hankerin' for something big and cheap? Just don't have enough room to store all that "media"? This round-up takes a different approach, focusing primarily on performance of the HDDs, factoring in street prices and ultimately determing which of the nine 2TB HDDs tested offers best bang-for-the-buck

item.title: [+482] Cadaver Lungs Still Breathing On Respirator (Video)
item.description: You fools! Don't you realize this is the first horrific step in creating a zombie apocalypse?!
